data.title: *****Best Persian in Atlanta Area *****
data.text: Absolutely delicious food and wonderful service! We had the weekend buffet and it was perfect. This is hands-down the best Persian restaurant in the Atlanta area!!!

data.title: excellent food and service
data.text: My wife and I were here on the 26th of August. the server was outstanding and the food was very fresh and good. I had taboullah, chicken wings, and salad, my wife had shrimp kebob. Everything was delicious. The hostess was not the friendliest but she did her job. The atmosphere was OK, kind of an open floor plan. the music was interesting but nice.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: My husband I visited this restaurant to celebrate Father's day. The menu selection is very unique. If you're looking something other than your standard menu, this is it. The food was top notch, service was good, and a great ambiance. Nice place to celebrate a special occasion.

data.title: Taking parents of friends out to Dinner
data.text:
Great place and excellent food. Among the more expensive and upscale restaurants. The service was great. The manager needs to brush up on his approach to customers. 

Ambience is excellent with live music playing. The wine selection on the menu was good

Enjoyed the dinner

data.title: A Treat &  A First For Persian Food!
data.text: With friends for dinner, we decided to try this restaurant. Service was very good and the waitress was helpful with our selections. We decided on a lamb kabob (my fav), basmati rice mixed with almonds, barberries and pistachio (different and tasty) and a smoked eggplant appetizer ( also good). Plenty of food choices and some vegetarian options. I like to try places of different cuisines & spices and this was a good choice.

data.title: We love this place
data.text: We think they have really great food. New have done the buffet a few times and each time really enjoyed it. Great selection of food. Great service. We will be going back. We only have good things to say about it. I think they have music on some nights so want to get there for that.  I love Persian food and this place does it good. Great atmosphere and decor as well. I recommend and will be going back.

data.title: Let 1001 Nights tantalize your tastebuds!
data.text: We have experienced 1001 Nights a few times now and each time was a delight!  There is no need to travel to the Perimeter or Buckhead anymore for superb Persian Cuisine!  It's right in Johns Creek!  Don't miss the Mirza Ghasemi, the Chicken Barq and the Rack of Lamb.  And when we were here on a Friday night, there was great live music.  Treat yourself to 1001 Nights!

data.title: Nice Persian food
data.text:
The food was average and the service was better.
I had chicken kabob and my friend had chicken barg kabob. My kabobs were somewhat dry and chewy and the barg was better, but had too much soy sauce.

data.title: Quality Buffet Experience
data.text: My husband and I had the restaurant all to ourselves between 11:30 am and 1 pm and I was starting to have doubts about the place but the quality of both the food and attention we received was outstanding. I remember another post that mentioned the extent of offerings and I'll concur that I've witnessed more items in a buffet. The quality of the cooking and the helpfulness of the management and staff, however, are exemplary. I'll definitely be back and make use of the coupons we were given with our bill.

data.title: Friends
data.text:
When we went out was really busy, took a while to get drinks.
Food was different but good.Lots of quantity is served per dish, so careful when u order(quantities).
Friendly staff, prices on the high side.
But with friends had fun(the whole experience)
At least try once

data.title: Wow, we all loved it!
data.text:
We all enjoyed our dinner here. This was a welcome break from the average night out with the family.  Even our teenagers had fun exploring the flavors of the Mediterranean.
We even saved 20% when we joined there VIP club.

data.title: Sunday buffet 10/12/2016
data.text: I read about the restaurant in groupon, and tried it out with my daughter. The food was excellent. Our waiter was phenomenon " I forgot to ask his name". The food was so good that after eating we asked for to go boxes and paid for 2 extra buffets. The beef and chicken kebabs was excellent. The rice dishes was phenomenal. The baklava was the best that I have ever eaten. I would recommend the restaurant to all my friends and family. I would definetly come back

data.title: Very good with veggie options
data.text: We visited this restaurant for team dinner. The place had nice ambience with good parking space. We had a platter to start with, where you can choose 3 items. We chose falafel, hummus and a spicy eggplant based item called 1001 nights spicy special. They all tasted very good. For maincourse, I had sautéed tofu. Which is sautéed tofu and vegetables accompanied by basmati rice. It tasted very good. I had Baklava for dessert, which was also yummy. The staff here were nice and helpful. I had a persian tea, which was good and free refills are offered. All in all, a good place to dine with a good number of options for vegetarians. I would definitely recommend this place for everyone (vegetarian or not).

data.title: Delightful
data.text:
The food is absolutely delicious. On a previous visit four of us shared the appetizer assortment. We ordered it again for two, but we were a bit full at the end of our meal. My husband said the salmon was the best he's ever tasted. My barg kabob was also excellent. I also substituted the rice with pistachios, orange and raisins. It's excellent. 

The service is also excellent, very attentive and friendly. The live music on Saturday night enhances the ambiance and its volume allows for quiet conversation. We highly recommend 1001 Nights.

data.title: The buffet is fabulous.
data.text:
We come here quite often but never had the buffet.  This is the best deal in Johns Creek.
It is not extensive,  but has high quality food with baclava for dessert. We also bring our own wine and have been doing it since it opened.
It now has a full bar.  The waitstaff is excellent and the owner is friendly.
It is oone of our three favorite restaurants here in JC.

data.title: Flavors!
data.text: You can't beat Persian food for their rice!  This restaurant was a nice surprise.  We have frequented Rumis downtown and 1001 Nights did not disappoint.  The staff were super friendly and the food fresh and flavorful.  Try any of the rice dishes, the veggie kebab or the lamb!

data.title: It's always a great pleasure to dine here!
data.text:
The experience at this restaurant is amazing! All the servers are great and I want to highlight Soufiane, who always takes great care of us. The food is full of exotic flavors from the beginning to the end! Ask for their icecream, the taste is incredible!  I have always order from the menu, but there is a buffet option as well if you want... maybe next time I'll try the Buffett.
It's always nice to have a great restaurant close home to bring your friends and family. If you are celebrating anything special, keep in mind to go on a Friday or Saturday, since there is live music... beautiful music!!!

data.title: Great service and food - very gluten free friendly
data.text: We had a group of 10 visiting the restaurant for the first time.  We were made to feel very welcome.  The waiters were very knowledgeable and took great care of us.  One of our party was on a gluten free diet and the waiter was able to work with the chef to suggest many options.   She was thrilled!  The appetizers were amazing and our main course was delicious.  I think everyone was very happy.

data.title: Friendly, Attentive Service
data.text: My daughter recommended this restaurant based upon having carry-out with a friend one night.  She enjoyed the kabob’s they ordered out so she wanted to experience sit-down dinner.  The service and food were very good.  Although we have a wide pallet, we have not dined on Persian often so it is difficult for us to compare to other Persian dining experiences.  After dinner at 1001 Nights, we will be dining on Persian more often.   Upon walking in we were asked if this was our first visit; we were welcomed and thanked for giving them a try.  The waiter was extremely helpful and gave us plenty of time to explore the menu.  The eggplant appetizer with Nan was outstanding, my daughter ordered the chicken kabob’s, I had the beef and my wife ordered lamb.  We all agreed the food was very good quality, served hot and very tasty.  About halfway through dinner the owner who greeted us upon arrival came to our table and inquired as to if everything was satisfactory.  We assured him that it was.   We will return to further explore the menu.

data.title: Great first experience with Persian food
data.text: Wasn't sure what to expect.  Had a business dinner here.  Food was good.  Portions are generous.  Would recomend.  Had the cornish hen with lentil rice.
